description: Overview for VictoriaMetrics cluster v1.29.0 or higher

panels.description: How many entries inverted index contains. This value is proportional to the number of unique timeseries in storage(cardinality).
panels.title: Index size

panels.description: Total amount of used disk space
panels.title: Disk space usage

panels.description: How many datapoints are in storage
panels.title: Total datapoints

panels.description: How many datapoints are inserted into storage per second
panels.title: Datapoints ingestion rate ($instance)

panels.description:
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Requests rate ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows how many of new time-series are created every second.  High churn rate tightly connected with database performance and may result in unexpected OOM's or slow queries. It is recommended to always keep an eye on this metric to avoid unexpected cardinality "explosions".

Good references to read:
* https://www.robustperception.io/cardinality-is-key
* https://www.robustperception.io/using-tsdb-analyze-to-investigate-churn-and-cardinality
panels.title: Churn rate ($instance)

panels.description:
The less time it takes is better.
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Query duration ($instance)

panels.description:
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Requests error rate ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows the number of active time series with new data points inserted during the last hour. High value may result in ingestion slowdown. 

See following link for details:
panels.title: Active time series ($instance)

panels.description: RPC errors are interconnection errors between cluster components. Errors rate should be 0 if network connection is stable and all components are up and operational.
panels.title: RPC errors ($instance)

panels.description: Amount of used memory (resident)
panels.title: Memory usage ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows number of pushed and sent rows. 
* `Pushed rows` - rows added to internal inserter buffers before send
* `Sent rows` - successfully transmitted rows to storage nodes
panels.title: Rows ($instance)

panels.description:
Rate of RPC errors by type:
* `Connection` - the number of connection errors to vmstorage node
* `Dial` -  the number of dial errors to vmstorage node.
* `Handshake` - the number of handshake errors to vmstorage node
* `Rerouted` - errors appeared during rerouting of rows from un-healthy storage node to a healthy one.
panels.title: RPC errors ($instance)

panels.description: The number of rows rerouted to the vmstorage node from other nodes when they were unhealthy.
panels.title: Rows ($instance) rerouted to

panels.description: The number of rows rerouted from the vmstorage node to healthy nodes when the given node was unhealthy.
panels.title: Rows ($instance) rerouted from

panels.description: The number of rows or bytes that vminesrt internal buffer contains at the moment.
panels.title: Pending

panels.description: The number of rows that were lost because of unhealthy vmstorage nodes.
panels.title: Rows lost  ($instance)

panels.description: Network usage by internal VictoriaMetrics RPC protocol
panels.title: RPC network usage ($instance)

panels.description: VictoriaMetrics stores various caches in RAM. Memory size for these caches may be limited with -`memory.allowedPercent` flag. Line `max allowed` shows max allowed memory size for cache.
panels.title: Cache size ($instance)

panels.description: VictoriaMetrics stores various caches in RAM. Memory size for these caches may be limited with -`memory.allowedPercent` flag. Line `max allowed` shows max allowed memory size for cache.
panels.title: Cache hit ratio ($instance)

panels.description: How many datapoints are in the storage.
panels.title: Datapoints ($instance)

panels.description: Shows how many rows per second every storage node accepts. This metric doesn't show all stored rows since some of them may be dropped because of wrong timestamps or decode errors.
panels.title: Ingestion rate ($instance)

panels.description: Shows amount of on-disk space occupied by inverted index.
panels.title: Disk space usage (index)  ($instance)

panels.description: Shows amount of on-disk space occupied by data points.
panels.title: Disk space usage (datapoints) ($instance)

panels.description: The number of on-going merges in storage nodes.  It is expected to have high numbers for `storage/small` metric.
panels.title: Active merges ($instance)

panels.description: How many datapoints are in RAM queue waiting to be written into storage. The less is better.
panels.title: Pending datapoints ($instance)

panels.description:
Data parts of LSM tree.
High number of parts could be an evidence of slow merge performance - check the resource utilization.
* `indexdb` - inverted index
* `storage/small` - recently added parts of data ingested into storage(hot data)
* `storage/big` -  small parts gradually merged into big parts (cold data)
panels.title: LSM parts ($instance)

panels.description: The number of rows merged per second by storage nodes.
panels.title: Merge speed

panels.description:
Shows how many ongoing insertions are taking place.
* `max` - equal to number of CPU * 2
* `current` - current number of goroutines busy with inserting rows into storage

When `current` hits `max` constantly, it means storage is overloaded and require more CPU.
panels.title: Concurrent inserts ($instance)

panels.description: Request rate accepted by vmselect nodes
panels.title: Requests rate ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows how many ongoing insertions are taking place.
* `max` - equal to number of CPU * 2 by default. May be configured with `search.maxConcurrentRequests` flag
* `current` - current number of goroutines busy with processing requests

When `current` hits `max` constantly, it means vmselect node is overloaded and require more CPU or higher limits.
panels.title: Concurrent selects ($instance)

panels.description:
* `*` - unsupported query path
* `/write` - insert into VM
* `/metrics` - query VM system metrics
* `/query` - query instant values
* `/query_range` - query over a range of time
* `/series` - match a certain label set
* `/label/{}/values` - query a list of label values (variables mostly)
panels.title: Requests rate ($instance)

panels.description:
Shows how many ongoing insertions are taking place.
* `max` - equal to number of CPU * 4 by default. May be configured with `maxConcurrentInserts` flag
* `current` - current number of goroutines busy with processing requests

When `current` hits `max` constantly, it means vminsert node is overloaded and require more CPU or higher limits.
panels.title: Concurrent inserts ($instance)

title: VictoriaMetrics - cluster
